meanings.definition: The study or analysis of the psychological motivations behind historical events.
meanings.sent1: In psychohistories, experts delve into the reasons why people acted as they did in the past.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use psychohistories to understand the hidden emotions that influenced historical decisions.
meanings.sent3: The book on psychohistories made me chuckle with its quirky take on analyzing historical figures' minds.
meanings.sent4: Psychohistories are like uncovering buried treasures of the past, revealing the secrets of human behavior.
meanings.sent5: The professor's lecture on psychohistories painted a vivid picture of the complex interplay between psychology and history.

meanings.definition: A collection or record of the psychological profiles of historical figures.
meanings.sent1: The library's collection of psychohistories provided insights into the minds of famous figures from the past.
meanings.sent2: Historians refer to psychohistories to gain a deeper understanding of the personalities of historical icons.
meanings.sent3: I found it amusing to read the psychohistories of famous leaders and see their quirks and habits.
meanings.sent4: Psychohistories are like time capsules of the past, preserving the thoughts and feelings of historical figures.
meanings.sent5: The psychohistories of great rulers bring their characters to life, making history more relatable and engaging.
